lines.text: Heat, work and energy are key concepts
Engines involve thermal energy and work

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we define and quantify the thermal energy and temperature of an object?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_k461:Thermodynamics] is the study of heat, work, and energy.
2. [OBJ:expsec_k462:Thermal energy] is the energy due to the molecular potential and kinetic energy within an object. Thermal energy is measured in [OBJ:expsec_k466:joules].
3. [OBJ:expsec_k464:Temperature] is the measure of the kinetic energy of the molecules within an object. Temperature can be measured with [OBJ:expsec_k467:thermometers].
